author: mini_mads1980
title: Great Starter Set
review:
This set proves that first impressions of sets can be completely wrong.  I thought that all three of the smaller Starter Sets were going to be terrible on first view of them.  In fact I only picked this set and 60088 up because they were already reduced in a supermarket - I now wish they had had 60072.

Box/Instructions

The box is the standard size for a set of about £9.  The front shows two crooks and a couple of swamp police officers, one of which is more of a CSI type woman, along with an Alligator/Crocodile, a red spider, small raft and a swamp boat.  The new 2015 style box looks great (as they all do) and in the bottom corner it proudly states Starter Set.

The sides have various warnings and the bottom of the box has production information and the barcode.  The top 1:1 picture is of the Swamp Policeman (sideways to fit box depth), and a nice picture of the younger crook hiding hill ill-gotten gains.

On the back we see what appear to be 1:1 scale images of all of the minifigures in the set.  An image of the raft being quickly caught by the swamp boat, and the police woman leading the two crook away to enjoy some free board.

Parts

This is a small set, and only contains 76 parts, but what LEGO has done with those parts is fantastic.  I was initially disapointed with the Crocodile tail, which attaches to the body by a blue pin.  It looked like it was never coming out again, however using the oar I was able to remove the pin quite easily.

I did smile when I opened the bag and saw the old space seat, which has room for a spaceman's airtank.  It brought back memories of my 1980's sets, and this put the parts up a point in my view!

Minifigures

FOUR! Yes, four minifgures in a set this size, and I paid £1 less than recommended too!  They are not anything special, but for a Starter Set this is great  You get two good and two bad which is going to enable hours of play without having to purchase other sets straight away.

The build

A couple of minutes is all it takes to build this, but with only 76 parts it was never going to take long.  The Swamp Boat is nicely put together, although the binoculars do fall off easily.

I marked the build experience up to three because of the nice use of SNOT for the raft.

The completed model

There are three main elements and they all compliment each other well.

Overall opinion

This is a great set, and I hope that the other Starter Sets are just as good!  If you see this in any store for the retail price or less then grab it!

author: legodad1
title: 3 Beasties, 4 Peops, lots of accessories for little expense
review:
Having recently acquired a Pirates set I've been keeping an eye out for a cheap way of purchasing a crocodile. This was my primary reason for buying this set (and it was on special) but it comes with an awful lot more for its size!

We get three swamp beasties: The crocodile with opening mouth and waggling tail, a snake and a red spider.

We also get four minifigures, two male crims, a male cop and a female cop. Counting the 'spare' pieces they come with two flash-lights, two pairs of handcuffs, a walkie-talkie, two paddles, two $100 notes, one backpack, one shovel, and one pair of binoculars. We also get a spare red beard which can be added to one of your other minifigures.

Parts-wise, we get a couple of 2x1 SNOT bricks, plus the 'space-man's seat'. The police logo on the front of the fan-boat is a PRINT, not a sticker. We also get five 1x4 and two 1x2 'log' bricks, two different leaf pieces, and a propellor among other parts.

A very-worthwhile acquisition!

author: The_Crea1or
title: 'Hey get back here!'
review:
While not the best City set released in 2015, it does offer a few interesting parts at a reasonable price.

Pros:

  • You get the new crocodile mold in a cheap set
  • The two vehicles offer enough play value for kids to create a story

Cons:

  • The set doesn't come with any interesting parts or figures apart from the crocodile
